data.title: Age, Family, Biography, Death, and Legacy
data.meta_description: Dick Scheffer was an American actor who is best known for The Lift, Lifespan, and Turkish Delight. Born on June 21, 1929, in Amsterdam, Noord-Holland,
data.text:
Dick Scheffer was an American actor who is best known for The Lift, Lifespan, and Turkish Delight. Born on June 21, 1929, in Amsterdam, Noord-Holland, Netherlands, he gained recognition in the film industry before passing away on November 24, 1986, in Noordwijk, Netherlands.

Personal and Family Life

Dick Scheffer was born Isaäc Komkommer. He had a nickname, Ies, which was familiar among his friends and colleagues. Details about his family life are not widely documented, but he was known to have a passion for acting from a young age, leading him to pursue a career in film.

Career

Scheffer’s acting career included significant roles that contributed to his popularity. He appeared in various films, showcasing his talent in both dramatic and comedic roles. His performances in films like Turkish Delight and The Lift earned him acclaim in the industry.

Death and Legacy

Dick Scheffer passed away on November 24, 1986, leaving behind a legacy as a notable actor in Dutch cinema. His work continues to be celebrated, and he is remembered for his contributions to film, particularly in the 1970s and 1980s.
